title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package directions.
While the pasta cooks, cut the guanciale into small cubes and fry until crispy. Remove the guanciale and set aside, keeping the rendered fat in the pan.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs and mix in the grated Pecorino Romano and a generous amount of black pepper.
Drain the spaghetti, reserving some of the pasta water. Add the spaghetti to the pan with the guanciale fat.

Remove the pan from the heat. Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing quickly to coat the spaghetti. Add a splash of pasta water if needed to create a creamy sauce. Stir in the crispy guanciale.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra Pecorino and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for at least 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked through.
In a large pan, saut√© onion until soft. Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomatoes, garam masala, and paprika. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Add the cooked chicken and heavy cream. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

title: Classic Beef Burgers
summary: Juicy homemade beef patties with fresh vegetables and a toasted bun.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Gently mix ground beef with Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Form the mixture into four equally sized patties.
Grill or pan-fry the patties to your desired doneness.
Toast the burger buns.
Assemble the burgers with your favorite toppings.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
summary: A quick and healthy stir-fry with a variety of colorful vegetables and a savory sauce.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, snap peas)
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic.
Heat a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add the mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat.
Serve hot over a bed of rice.
